intro: Eleutherostemon gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-leaved eleutherostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within forest understories.
